message_1: Suppose two players, Alice and Bob, are playing a centipede game where they can take turns choosing between "Cooperate" and "Defect." If both players choose "Cooperate," Alice earns 4 points and Bob earns 3 points. If one player chooses "Defect" while the other chooses "Cooperate," the defector earns 6 points and the cooperator earns 1 point. If both players choose "Defect," Alice earns 2 points and Bob earns 1 point. If the game gets to the 10th round and both players have always chosen "Cooperate," how many points will they have earned up to that point?
message_2:
In each round, if both players choose "Cooperate," Alice earns 4 points and Bob earns 3 points. After 10 rounds of both players choosing "Cooperate," the total points earned by each player will be:

Alice: 4 points/round * 10 rounds = 40 points
Bob: 3 points/round * 10 rounds = 30 points

So, up to the 10th round, Alice will have earned 40 points and Bob will have earned 30 points.
